[[War in Afghanistan (2001âpresent)|Afghanistan]] |awards = [[Order of Australia|Officer of the Order of Australia]] |laterwork = }} [[Major General (Australia)|Major General]] '''Paul Bruce Symon''', [[Order of Australia|AO]] is a senior officer in the Australian Army and is currently serving as the [[Deputy Chief of Army (Australia)|Deputy Chief of Army]]. ==Biography== ===Military career=== After completing his training at the [[Royal Military College, Duntroon]], Symon was allocated to the [[Royal Australian Artillery|Royal Regiment of Australian Artillery]] (RAA). Following 16 years of service he became the commanding officer of the [[1st Regiment, Royal Australian Artillery|1st Field Regiment, Royal Australian Artillery]]. In 1997 Symon served with the United Nations in South Lebanon during a period of great tension between Hezbollah and the Israeli Defence Force. He has also taught at the [[Royal Military Academy Sandhurst]] (RMAS). ===Personal life=== Symon is married to his wife of 25 years (Kate) and they have two teenage children. He gains pleasure running half marathons and in the company of his family and friends. ==Honours and Awards==
